parts.text: {"word":"menghemat","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitive","definition":"to save (money, time, energy, etc.); to economize","english_definition":"to use less of something, such as money, time, or energy; to avoid waste; to economize.","examples":[{"sentence":"Kita harus menghemat air.","translation":"We must save water.","explanation":"This sentence shows the basic meaning of saving a resource."},{"sentence":"Dia mencoba menghemat uang untuk membeli mobil baru.","translation":"He is trying to save money to buy a new car.","explanation":"This example demonstrates saving money for a specific purpose."},{"sentence":"Dengan berjalan kaki, kita bisa menghemat bensin.","translation":"By walking, we can save gasoline.","explanation":"This illustrates saving fuel by choosing an alternative mode of transportation."},{"sentence":"Matikan lampu untuk menghemat energi.","translation":"Turn off the lights to save energy.","explanation":"This shows a practical way to conserve energy."}],"collocations":["menghemat uang (save money)","menghemat waktu (save time)","menghemat energi (save energy)","menghemat biaya (save costs)","berusaha menghemat (try to save)"],"synonyms":["menabung","menyimpan","mengurangi","meminimalkan","berhemat"],"antonyms":["memboroskan","menghambur-hamburkan","membelanjakan","menggunakan"],"related_words":["hemat (frugal, thrifty, economical)","kehematan (thriftiness, frugality, economy)"],"usage_notes":"'Menghemat' is used in contexts where the goal is to reduce consumption or expenditure of a resource. It implies a conscious effort to avoid waste.","level_frequency":{"frequency":"High","level":"Beginner"},"cultural_considerations":"Saving and being thrifty are generally considered positive traits in Indonesian culture, reflecting values of resourcefulness and financial responsibility."}],"etymology":{"origin":"Derived from the root word 'hemat,' which means frugal or thrifty.","priority":"Medium"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/məŋˈɦɛmat/","audio":"[audio file of pronunciation]"},"inflection":{"affixes":["me- (active transitive prefix)"],"root":"hemat"},"common_mistakes":{"mistake1":"Using 'menyimpan' (to store) when 'menghemat' (to save by reducing consumption) is more appropriate.","mistake2":"Forgetting the 'meng-' prefix, which changes the word into an active verb."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"Pemerintah mengimbau masyarakat untuk menghemat listrik.","translation":"The government urges the public to save electricity.","explanation":"This sentence demonstrates a formal usage of the word in a public announcement."},{"sentence":"Kita bisa menghemat banyak uang dengan memasak di rumah daripada makan di luar.","translation":"We can save a lot of money by cooking at home instead of eating out.","explanation":"This shows a practical example of saving money in daily life."}]}
